title: Senior Accountant Job at Brenhazy Limited
content:
Brenhazy Limited is a privately owned Nigerian company incorporated in 2014 to provide Manpower Services, Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) services to companies in line with standard requirements and global best practices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Accountant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Managing thecompany's financial activities such as: Audit support, Financial reporting, Budgeting and Forecasting, Internal controls, Data Analysis, Accounting Operations,Compliance, etc.


Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Candidate will be saddled with the responsibilities of managing / Processing Payroll, Inventory, work with regulatory agencies, develop and impliment new accounting systems or processes, make Financial decisions, posting and reconcile accounts payable and receivables, producing error free accounting reports and representing results, maintain accurate records of financial statements of the company.


Educational Qualification and Experience

N200,000 - N300,000 / Month.

title: Tax Manager Job at Zipline
content:
Zipline - Do you want to change the world? Zipline uses drones to deliver critical and life-saving medicine to thousands of hospitals serving millions of people in multiple countries. Our mission is to provide every human on Earth with instant access to vital medical supplies. Join Zipline and help us make this a reality for billions of people.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Tax Manager, Africa

Job Location: Lagos
Job Schedule: Full-time

About You and The Role  
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a hands-on, motivated Tax Manager to manage all African country taxes. We are located in Cote D’Ivoire, Ghana, Kenya, Nigeria, and Rwanda. You will manage all taxes (excluding payroll taxes) in these countries to ensure they’re accurately and timely filed. You will collaborate with the Accounting and Finance team to ensure tax-related accounts are correctly reflected in the financials. 
	You will perform reviews of the income tax provision for statutory financial reporting and corporate income tax returns. 
	You will collaborate with local Accounting and Finance leads on tax audits. 
	As our key tax person, you will continue to look for ways to increase efficiency in the tax processes without sacrificing quality while looking for ways to minimize our taxes through thoughtful tax planning ideas. 
	The Africa Tax Manager will report to the Head of Tax with a dotted line to African Country Controller. The Africa Tax Manager will serve as the Tax Lead for all African countries. 


What You'll Do
The Africa Tax Manager will perform the following duties:


	Prepare VAT and other indirect tax returns for all African countries
	Prepare monthly tax account reconciliations
	Prepare audit ready tax workpapers and documentation
	Prepare and manage quarterly Corporate Income Tax (CIT) tax declarations and any required payments
	Review and monitor intercompany transactions for tax implications
	Manage African countries tax calendar to ensure timely filing of all tax returns and declarations
	Collaborate with local accounting and finance leads to manage tax audits 
	Gather documentation and manage all (CIT) returns to ensure returns are accurately and timely filed by external tax preparers
	Review annual income tax provision calculations
	Assist in preparing and reviewing transfer pricing calculations
	Collaborate with the Accounting and Finance teams to address all tax related matters
	Provide tax consultation and training to other business functions
	Provide tax development and updates to the Head of Tax and other business functions
	Liaise and manage relationship with outside tax advisors
	Collaborate with Head of Tax to develop and implement tax planning ideas
	Continue to enhance and improve internal control in the tax area
	Support other countries outside of Africa as needed


Requirements
What You'll Bring:


	Candidates should a Bachelor's Degree Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	At least 7 years of tax experience working with a multinational company with operations in various African countries and/or similar experience from an international public accounting firm
	Graduate degree or professional certification is a plus 
	Strong analytical, problem-solving and organizational skills
	Excellent communication (oral and written) and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and willing to work outside of business hours with colleagues overseas primarily in the USA
	Proficient with software such as Microsoft Officer Suite and/or Google G Suite specifically Excel and Google Sheet.

title: HSE Officer Job at Fave Consulting
content:
Fave Consulting - Our client, a leading FMCG Manufacturing company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HSE Officer

Job Location: Kano
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	A leading FMCG manufacturing company in Kano is seeking a highly competent Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) Officer to drive compliance, enforce HSE policies, and ensure a safe, healthy, and environmentally responsible workplace.
	This role demands a proactive professional with strong regulatory knowledge and field experience in industrial environments.


Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop, implement, and continuously improve HSE policies, procedures, and programs.
	Conduct regular risk assessments and ensure effective implementation of preventive measures.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to embed safety into all operations.
	Investigate incidents, determine root causes, and implement corrective actions.
	Ensure full compliance with all relevant HSE regulations and industry standards.
	Lead safety induction and training programs to strengthen the safety culture.
	Maintain accurate HSE records and reports; engage with regulatory bodies as needed.
	Support environmental management efforts including waste reduction and sustainability initiatives.


Requirements


	Degree in Safety, Environmental Science, or a related discipline (mandatory).
	5 - 10 years of HSE experience in a reputable FMCG or industrial setting.
	Strong grasp of occupational health and safety laws and risk management practices.
	Proven ability to lead safety initiatives and drive continuous improvement.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office; knowledge of safety information systems is a plus.
	Excellent communication, coordination, and reporting skills.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter in PDF to: recruitment@faveconsulting.com using "HSE Officer" as the subject of the email.

title: Backend Developer Job at Revent Technologies Limited
content:
Revent Technologies Limited is a technology solutions provider for dynamic organisations, providing bespoke software design and development, developer outsourcing and technology advisory services, etc.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Backend Developer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment type: Full Time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As a Software Engineer specializing in back-end development, you will build new product features from start to finish (e.g. develop & deploy new demand models served into production systems).
	You will also have the opportunity to review & influence the engineering design, architecture & technology stack across multiple products, outside your immediate focus.
	You will work on a DevOps software engineering team dedicated to building enterprise applications with the latest and greatest cloud-first technology to enable key parts of our business.
	From contributing to new applications to enhancing existing products, you will work amongst a team of passionate software engineers, facilitated by a scrum master, with work prioritized by product owners.


As a SDE you will work at the intersection of:


	Application of machine learning/deep learning solutions.
	Best in class cloud technology & micro-services architecture.
	Use DevOps best practices that include model serving, data & code versioning.


Responsibilities


	You will work on building code that will deploy into production, using code design & stylestandards.
	You will document your thought process & create artefact on team repo/wiki that can be used to share with business & engineering for sign off.
	Must be able to manage applications currently in Production Environment
	You will also develop internal tools/utils that improve productivity of entire team.
	You will collaborate with other team members to advance team’s ability to ship high quality code, fast!
	You will review code quality, design developed by your peers.
	You will significantly improve the performance & reliability of our code that create high quality & reproducible results.
	You should be able to mentor/coach junior team members to continuously upskill them.
	You will maintain basic developer hygiene that includes but not limited to, writing tests, using loggers.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, related field or equivalent experience
	3+ years of professional software development real-world experience to develop scalable & high-quality software.
	Excellent understanding of Node JS, mySql, MSSQL, PostgreSQL
	Experience in backend related Azure cloud components such as Web app, Functions is a plus
	Knowledge of front end technology is an added advantage
	In depth understand of docker, git, GitHub & GitHub actions.
	Experience in debugging and profiling applications, and improving their efficiency, scalability, and stability
	Good foundation in data structures & algorithms.
	Strong experience in code versioning using Git (or alike), maintaining one modularized code base for multiple deployments, automation using CI/CD pipelines.
	Strong relationship management, communication and collaboration skills: effectively working with both technical and non-technical audiences
	A true self-starter, who dreams big, and is motivated by a challenging and fast-paced environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cv to: hr@reventtechnologies.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
